title: 3D typography like Dimensional Typography by J Abbott Miller
content:
I've been interested in 3D typography.  
Could youguys please recommend good references like “Dimensional Typography: Words in Space” by J Abbott Miller?  
Thx! Thx!
author: finvox

A couple of months ago, I found [http://typophile.com/node/18913](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019172807/http:/typophile.com/node/18913 "http://typophile.com/node/18913")

Actually, I’m writing a paper too.

As far as I know, "Dimensional Typography by J Abbott Miller" was published in 1996.

Of course, this is still 'GO\_\_\_\_OD'.

However, I'm searching for something newer.

Recently, either online or offline, has this kind of book been published?

If you know, let me know please...

\* Thank you for your favor about reading of my poor English~
Here is [**a little something by Daniel Pelavin**](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019172807/http:/www.pelavin.com/14.html).

Mirko Ilic has created some illustrations for _The New York Times_ using dimensional type. I'm posting an image of the one example I could find on [**his website**](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019172807/http:/www.mirkoilic.com/), but I've seen others.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019172807im_/http:/typophile.com/files/mirko_ilic_6156.png)

_As far as I know, “Dimensional Typography by J Abbott Miller” was published in 1996. [. . .] However, I’m searching for something newer._

Well, not to flog a dead horse, but the _Univers Revolved_ book is from 2004.

But I can also recommend a newer book: [**_New Typographic Design_**](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019172807/http:/yalepress.yale.edu/yupbooks/book.asp?isbn=9780300117752) (2007), edited by Roger Fawcett-Tang. There are several examples of dimensional typography scattered throughout it, especially in the Type In Motion section at the end.

Oh, and then there's this cool stuff:  
 [http://www.nofont.com/section\_experiments/index.asp](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019172807/http:/www.nofont.com/section_experiments/index.asp "http://www.nofont.com/section\_experiments/index.asp")  
Check out all of them!

hhp

How about thr real thing: punch cutting?

Smeijers, Fred:  
Counterpunch: Making Type in the Sixteenth Century, Designing Typefaces Now. Hyphen Press, 1996

Well, the "problem" with punchcutting is that you're not supposed to end up seeing anything but the face. The only way the "neck" matters is if the impression depth is sickeningly great.

Big in 1986

Well, I know a site, runned by a portuguese designer named Victor Quelhas who has given a conference on dynamic typography in 2006, at Atypi Lisbon. The site is [http://www.dyntypo.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019172807/http:/www.dyntypo.com/ "http://www.dyntypo.com/"), which is open to everyone who wants to share theirs experiments on the subject. It has a lot of links and the possibility to comment and interact with the objects and the creators. Hope it helps!
